title: Calories in Pepperoni Pizza
meta_description: Discover calories in pepperoni pizza per slice, including macros like protein, fat, carbs, and sodium, plus tweaks and FAQs for better choices.
assumptions: Standard 14-inch pepperoni pizza with 8 slices; includes wheat crust, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and pepperoni; baked, no extra oil or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, crust type, topping amount, and baking method. Check labels or apps for specific products.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of pepperoni pizza contains about 285 calories and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of pepperoni pizza?
faqs.a: Approximately 285 kcal for a standard slice.

faqs.q: What are the macros in pepperoni pizza?
faqs.a: Per slice: 35 g carbs, 13 g protein, 12 g fat, with 680 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Does pepperoni pizza have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 680 mg per slice, mainly from cheese and pepperoni.

faqs.q: How do calories change with different crusts?
faqs.a: Thin crust reduces by ~50 kcal; deep dish adds ~100 kcal per slice.

faqs.q: Is pepperoni pizza high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: It has 5 g saturated fat per slice, from cheese and pepperoni.
